Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Looking through the event log, I identify recurring activities within the same case: 'Verify Documents' and 'Call Customer'. These activities appear multiple times within specific cases (C001, C002, C003) and seem to have different contextual meanings.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For example, in Case C001, the first 'Verify Documents' involves initial document verification, whereas the second 'Verify Documents' occurs after receiving an additional ID scan and thus represents re-verification with additional information. Similarly, in Case C002, 'Call Customer' appears twice: first to clarify an account discrepancy and later as a follow-up confirmation after adjustments are made.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzing all three cases (C001, C002, C003), I've deduced a pattern: activities that recur within a single case often differ in purpose depending on their position in the sequence and contextual details provided in the log.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: To systematically rename these recurring activities, I apply the heuristic of using contextual cues (e.g., 'Additional Context' field) and the temporal position of activities in the sequence. For instance, when 'Verify Documents' occurs immediately after 'Submit Additional' in C001, its purpose seems to be re-checking information, so I rename it 'Additional Document Verification'.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I validate these renaming choices by cross-referencing the provided 'Additional Context' field with the temporal flow of activities for each case. This helps ensure that renamed activities match their specific contextual purposes (e.g., distinguishing the first 'Call Customer' in C002 as 'Clarify Discrepancy Call' and the second as 'Adjustment Confirmation Call').
